abstract: Google is abandoning a planned advertising partnership with Yahoo in the face of a looming antitrust challenge by the government.
lead_paragraph: Google is abandoning a planned advertising partnership with Yahoo in the face of a looming antitrust challenge by the government.

abstract: The move, which came after antitrust regulators raised objections, leaves Yahoo scrambling for a plan for growth.
snippet: The move, which came after antitrust regulators raised objections, leaves Yahoo scrambling for a plan for growth.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Google offered its rival Yahoo a marriage of convenience this past summer: an advertising partnership that gave Yahoo an alternative to selling all or part of itself to Microsoft.

headline.main: Google Won’t Pursue Yahoo Ad Deal
headline.print_headline: Google Out Of Ad Deal With Yahoo

byline.original: By Miguel Helft and Steve Lohr

abstract: Sue Decker tells Yahoos that the Google deal was just one of many pieces in Yahoo’s turnaround plan.
snippet: Sue Decker tells Yahoos that the Google deal was just one of many pieces in Yahoo’s turnaround plan.
lead_paragraph: Google decided to end its advertising partnership with Yahoo on Wednesday rather than fight a suit from the Justice Department.

headline.main: Sue Decker’s Memo to the Yahoo Troops

abstract: Yahoo has lost a year in its endless maneuvering with Microsoft and Google and is likely to lose months more as it ponders its next move.
snippet: Yahoo has lost a year in its endless maneuvering with Microsoft and Google and is likely to lose months more as it ponders its next move.
lead_paragraph: Like Microsoft before it, Google has now decided that Yahoo is not worth fighting for. Google said Wednesday that it would not challenge the Justice Department, which objected to its plan to sell some ads on behalf of Yahoo.

abstract: Jack Flack had started to worry that Google‘s proposed search alliance with Yahoo had become more than simply a tactic for delaying Microsoft‘s acquisition of the search industry’s fading No. 2. But, when properly translated, Wednesday’s blog posting by Google’s top lawyer and deal maker, David Drummond, confirms that Google is far more interested in the overall war than it is in fighting a counter productive side battle.
lead_paragraph: Jack Flack had started to worry that Google‘s proposed search alliance with Yahoo had become more than simply a tactic for delaying Microsoft‘s acquisition of the search industry’s fading No. 2. But, when properly translated, Wednesday’s blog posting by Google’s top lawyer and deal maker, David Drummond, confirms that Google is far more interested in the overall war than it is in fighting a counter productive side battle.

abstract: With Google out of the picture, Yahoo‘s embattled chief executive, Jerry Yang, may be forced to decide whether to run back into Microsoft‘s hands or try to do a quick deal with Time Warner‘s AOL unit.
lead_paragraph: With Google out of the picture, Yahoo‘s embattled chief executive, Jerry Yang, may be forced to decide whether to run back into Microsoft‘s hands or try to do a quick deal with Time Warner‘s AOL unit.

headline.main: With Google Gone, Yahoo’s Future Seems Clouded

abstract: Like a rejected lover who feels the need to tell all the kids at school an embarrassing secret about the person who jilted him or her, Yahoo was apparently distressed enough over Google‘s abandonment to explicitly point that the Justice Department had informed Google that it would block its Yahoo deal, a fact that Google soft-pedaled in its account.
lead_paragraph: Like a rejected lover who feels the need to tell all the kids at school an embarrassing secret about the person who jilted him or her, Yahoo was apparently distressed enough over Google‘s abandonment to explicitly point that the Justice Department had informed Google that it would block its Yahoo deal, a fact that Google soft-pedaled in its account.

headline.main: Parsing Yahoo: Want to Know a Secret?

abstract: If you use Gmail and get annoyed by its worried alert box about the lack of body text, there is a simple fix to save a mouse click.
snippet: If you use Gmail and get annoyed by its worried alert box about the lack of body text, there is a simple fix to save a mouse click.
lead_paragraph: Sometimes the Subject line of an e-mail message is all you need: “Meet me at the theater at 7:45.” If you use Gmail and get annoyed by its worried alert box about the lack of body text, there is a simple fix to save a mouse click. Just type EOM (short for End of Message) after the text on the subject line and fire away. The message will be sent post haste.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Taming Gmail’s Alert Box
